decisionTemplate.name: Fit for Dynamic Services (Fit4DS)
decisionTemplate.description: Transformation von Applikationen von konventionellen Infrastrukturen auf Cloud Infrastrukturen oder Plattformen(Cloud Readiness Assessment)mit Ber√ºcksichtigung von realen Nebenbedingungen aus DSBA und DSI

alternative.name: Dynmic Services for Business Applications (DSBA)
alternative.description: Use of the T-Systems cloud infrastructure approach. This IaaS approach includes typical infrastructure maintenence services, which have to be specified and detailed during the customer consulting. Example: Backup. For the business case, both running operating costs and transformation costs will be included.

alternative.name: Dynamic Service for Infrastructure (maintenence service)
alternative.description: Use of the T-Systems cloud infrastructure approach. This IaaS approach includes typical infrastructure maintenence services, which have to be specified and detailed during the customer consulting. Example: Backup. For the business case, both running operating costs and transformation costs will be included.

alternative.name: Dynamic Service for Infrastructure (no maintenence)
alternative.description: Use of non-cloud T-Systems classical application hosting. For the busines case, all operation costs including platform services and transition will be used.

alternative.name: Classical Hosting
alternative.description: Don't change the current mode of operation. NOTE: This Mode must be reworked according to the concrete customer situation. The figures inside are only very rough dummies.

alternative.name: Keep Current Mode of Operation
alternative.description: Use of the T-Systems cloud platform approach. For the business case, both running operating costs and transformation costs will be included.

goal.name: Static Cost
goal.description: Total cost of ownership of one (set of) application(s) calculated on the assumed runtime. Basicaly once the TandT costs + running costs over the assumed runtime.

goal.name: Quality
goal.description: operational stability of the solution, measured against customer given SLA perhaps on different levels.

criterion.name: Average Availability
criterion.description: Typical ##.##% SLA possibly measured on various levels (application, platform, infrastructure)

criterion.name: Monthly Downtimes
criterion.description: Hours of planned downtime (per month or other reasonable time slice)

criterion.name: Time-to-recover
criterion.description: Hours to recover after a fatal error (backup resostore time)

goal.name: Flexibility
goal.description: General ability to adapt to changed quantative requirements

criterion.name: Workload Share
criterion.description: Time to move workloads between existing operating platforms

criterion.name: Financial
criterion.description: linear impact of scaling changes to running costs (pay what you use)
